item.description:
GRAP-4: Delhi-NCR Schools To Go Hybrid For All Classes Except Grades 10, 12

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: News18

Schools in Delhi-NCR will shift to hybrid classes, combining online and physical attendance for most grades, due to severe air quality issues.

  • Classes VI to IX and XI will now be hybrid as part of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage 4.
  • Decision triggered by alarming Air Quality Index levels surpassing 400.
  • Schools in districts like Gurugram, Faridabad, and Ghaziabad are included in this mandate.

“Noida schools are very much offline; they have not declared hybrid classes.” - Ayesha Singh, Parent

The hybrid model aims to ensure safety and continuity of education amid worsening air quality in the region.

item.title: Cold wave continues to sweep North India, Punjab's Faridkot at minimum temperature of zero degree - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold Wave Affects Northern India, Faridkot Hits Zero Degrees

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave continues to impact many areas of northern and eastern India, with Faridkot recording a minimum temperature of zero degrees Celsius.

  • Minimum temperatures have plunged in Jammu and Kashmir, Jharkhand, Haryana, and Punjab.
  • The national capital, Delhi, registered a minimum temperature of 5.9 degrees Celsius, which is below normal.
  • Other affected regions include Amritsar (2.6 degrees), Ludhiana (4.8 degrees), and Patiala (4.8 degrees).
  • Karnal recorded a low of 4.6 degrees Celsius in Haryana.
  • Rajasthan is experiencing extremely cold conditions with Karauli seeing a minimum of 1.3 degrees Celsius.
  • In Kashmir, Konibal recorded the coldest temperature at minus 8.5 degrees Celsius.
“Water supply lines in several parts of the Valley are frozen due to the cold,” officials stated.

The cold wave is expected to continue, with the Indian Meteorological Department predicting a slight rise in temperatures in East India while maintaining dry weather conditions until December 26.

item.title: Congress considered Constitution private fiefdom of one family, says Amit Shah - The Hindu
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Congress Over Constitutional Amendments

Date: December 17, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The ongoing debate on the Constitution saw Union Home Minister Amit Shah accuse Congress of manipulating constitutional provisions for political gain, while defending the BJP's amendments as aimed at empowering citizens.

  • Shah labeled Congress as "anti-reservation" and claimed their push for increasing the reservation ceiling aims to introduce religion-based reservations.
  • He noted Congress's history of amendments, stating they made 77 changes during their rule compared to 22 by the BJP.
  • The discussion was part of a 31-hour debate commemorating 75 years of the Indian Constitution.
  • Shah reaffirmed the BJP's stance against religion-based reservations and emphasized the secular nature of the Indian Constitution.
“The Congress considered the Constitution as private fiefdom of one family and deceived Parliament.” - Amit Shah

This debate highlights the ongoing political contention over constitutional amendments in India, as parties clash over their historical actions and principles.

item.title: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose - News18
item.description:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

Two bills enabling simultaneous elections were introduced in the Lok Sabha after a heated debate, with 269 votes in favor and 198 against.

  • The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024 and The Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024 were formally introduced.
  • The bills propose simultaneous elections for both Lok Sabha and state assemblies.
  • The bills will be sent to a Joint Parliamentary Committee for detailed discussions.
  • Opposition claims the bills attack the federal structure.
  • The electronic voting system was used for the first time in the new Parliament House.
“The electors have the right to elect the government for five years, and this right cannot be curtailed with simultaneous elections.” - DMK MP TR Baalu

In conclusion, the introduction of these bills has sparked considerable debate regarding their impact on India’s federal structure.

item.title: Delhi metro services to be hit on this route for over ten days | Check details - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Metro Services Disrupted for Over Ten Days Starting December 18

Publication Date: December 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) announced that train services between Jahangirpuri and Samaypur Badli will be disrupted for over ten days starting from December 18. The exact reason for the disruption has not been disclosed.

  • Train services will not be available after 10:45 PM and before 7:02 AM during the specified period.
  • Samaypur Badli, Rohini Sector-18, 19, and Haiderpur Badli Mor stations will remain closed.
  • Normal services will still be available between Jahangirpuri and Millennium City Centre Gurugram.
  • Train services on the Red Line will also be suspended after 11:30 PM on New Year's Eve.
  • Cable thefts at Delhi Metro stations have increased, with 44 cases reported in 2024 compared to 38 in 2023.
“Thefts could be further prevented by lighting areas which are dark during the night and increasing CCTV coverage of the tracks.” - Senior Police Official

In conclusion, disruptions in metro services alongside rising theft incidents pose challenges for commuters in the region, prompting authorities to enhance monitoring and security measures.

item.description:
BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate

Date: December 17, 2024

Source: News18

During a debate in Rajya Sabha, Union Minister JP Nadda stated that the BJP government has ended the 'one nation, two constitutions' policy in Jammu and Kashmir, emphasizing the applicability of national laws.

  • Nadda criticized the Congress party for their historical policies regarding Jammu and Kashmir.
  • He mentioned that numerous laws, including the 73rd and 74th Amendments, were not applicable to J&K.
  • Nadda referenced the unity efforts of Sardar Patel, highlighting his significance in India's integration.
  • He brought up the topic of emergency in India and Congress's role in it, urging a reflection on its history.
  • The debate also covered topics like triple talaq and its relevance in Islamic countries compared to India.
“The then Home Minister Sardar Patel was given the work of uniting the country and I was very happy that after a long time, I heard the name of Sardar Patel from the Congress side too.”

The debate in Parliament aims to affirm the shared historical significance of the Constitution and its role in India's governance.

item.description:
LK Advani likely to be shifted from ICU within next 1-2 days, says hospital treating veteran BJP leader

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

Lal Krishna Advani, India's former Deputy Prime Minister, has been under medical care at Indraprastha Apollo Hospital since December 12. He has shown gradual improvement and is expected to be moved out of the ICU shortly.

  • Advani, aged 97, was admitted for medical management and investigations.
  • He is under the care of Dr. Vinit Suri and is reported to be stable.
  • This is not Advani's first hospitalization this year, having had multiple admissions for various check-ups.
  • He was awarded the Bharat Ratna in March 2024, India's highest civilian honor.
“Shri LK Advani ji has shown gradual improvement in his medical condition. Based on his progress, he is likely to be shifted out of the ICU within the next 1-2 days.”

The outlook for Advani appears positive as he continues to receive medical attention, highlighting the significance of his contributions to Indian politics over his long career.

item.title: 'Possibility Of Reformation Can't Be Ruled Out': Supreme Court Commutes Death Penalty Of Man Convicted... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Alters Death Sentence to 25 Years Imprisonment in Child Murder Case

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has commuted the death penalty of a man convicted of the sexual assault and murder of a 4-year-old child to a sentence of 25 years imprisonment, considering potential for reformation based on behavioral assessments.

  1. The court upheld the conviction but ruled on the sentence due to reports indicating the possibility of reformation.
  2. The convict had committed the crime under deceptive circumstances and lacked a plausible explanation for the child’s death.
  3. Crucial evidence included the timeline of events and consistent witness testimonies supporting the prosecution's case.
  4. The conviction was based on strong circumstantial evidence, including matching blood types and injuries suggesting sexual assault.
  5. Reports from jail and mental health assessments characterized the convict's behavior and state of mind as normal, indicating potential for change.
“The present is not a case where it can be said that the possibility of reformation is completely ruled out.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's decision reflects a nuanced approach in adjudicating serious crimes, balancing justice for the victim with the potential for the convict's rehabilitation.

item.title: Karnataka High Court rejects PIL against State decision to halt property mutations amidst Waqf land dispute - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Karnataka High Court Dismisses PIL on Property Mutations in Waqf Land Dispute

Published on: 17 Dec 2024, 1:09 pm

The Karnataka High Court dismissed a Public Interest Litigation petition challenging a recent government circular that halted property mutations related to Waqf land. The court deemed the PIL vague, stating that the government’s action was in the public interest.

  • The Karnataka High Court rejected a PIL against a government order halting property mutations.
  • The court claimed the petition was primarily for publicity, not a legitimate legal challenge.
  • The PIL arose from concerns over 91,000 acres of Waqf land allegedly encroached upon in Karnataka.
  • The Karnataka government’s notification aimed to protect farmers’ lands from being designated as Waqf properties.
  • Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had previously directed authorities to halt property transfers affecting farmers.
“If a direction is issued by the authorities to stop the creation of khata in favour of Waqf... such directions can be perceived only in relation to public good and public interest.”

The dismissal of the PIL highlights the court's stance on prioritizing public interest in disputes over land use and protection.

item.title: Fine of up to ₹1 crore for airline bomb hoax threats - The Hindu
item.description:
Fine of up to ₹1 crore for airline bomb hoax threats

Published: December 17, 2024 06:30 pm IST   |   Source: The Hindu

Weeks after hundreds of hoax bomb threats for airlines in the country threw security agencies into a tizzy, the central government has amended the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2023 providing a fine of up to ₹1 crore for such offences.

  • The Ministry of Civil Aviation has introduced new rules making false bomb threat communication punishable.
  • The penalties vary from ₹1 lakh to ₹1 crore depending on the offender's identity.
  • A total of 999 hoax bomb threats were reported from January to November 14, 2024.
“There were 666 threats made in October alone.”

Only two individuals have been detained in connection to the hoax calls. The new rules will not be applied retrospectively.
